abstract: Black Lives Matter, which has evolved from hashtag prompted by police shootings into civil rights movement, is struggling to find unified voice as various groups falling under its banner make forays into national politics; some groups have sought to influence direction of national elections, while others have expressed distrust of political system and called for more radical approach; while some see diversity as source of energy, others says more solidarity is needed to effect change.
lead_paragraph: Black Lives Matter has become an Internet-driven civil rights movement. Today, a number of groups under that banner are trying to influence politics nationwide in a variety of ways.

headline.main: One Slogan, Many Methods: Black Lives Matter Enters Politics
headline.print_headline: Black Lives Matter Seeks Political Voice From the Din of Protest

snippet: Black Lives Matter has become an Internet-driven civil rights movement. Today, a number of groups under that banner are trying to influence politics nationwide in a variety of ways.
